resume.achievementsSmaillTitle: Involved in web architecture and design
resume.achievementsContent1: When I first joined ByteXByte, I was primarily responsible for coordinating with UI designers from American companies. Based on the priorities, I collaborated with other engineers to complete new pages and features. Basic functions and interfaces were smoothly developed and delivered on time. A notable challenge I overcame was implementing real-time user registration status verification through sockets during independent user sign-up and login processes. After spending several days on this task, seeing the results gave me a great sense of accomplishment. Given that this project essentially involved controlling the app display through a web interface, and with the increasing volume of data, plus the requirement to create a superuser for the website, we discussed database schemas. Following that, I started with next's API. Through nextAuth, once I obtained the Session, I determined the data access permissions, then, in the frontend SSR props, I decided on the data to fetch from the backend and displayed various data based on permissions.
resume.achievementsContent2: During my tenure at this company, I had the opportunity to work on a project for Lamborghini where we installed our company's product on their official vehicles. Once scanned, the app would display the NFT Redemption status set on the website by the company. I participated in this project from its inception to its operational phase. After the website became stable, I shifted focus to Swift to adjust the NFC scanning to comply with the updated iOS standards and frontend display of scanning events.
resume.achievementsContent3: On the freelance side, I upgraded a Java Spring API server to a more versatile gateway. I used Express as the foundational framework and coded in TypeScript. With the comprehensive Axios ecosystem at my disposal, I modularized proxy and header functionalities. I plan to implement a class-based approach to allow any new service providers to swiftly construct dedicated services.
